description: 55 multiple‑choice questions derived from conceptual content of the CRFD‑MDL1 Training Guidebook (excludes exercises and slide option references).

questions.text: Which phases comprise the Modeling Parts Framework in Creo?
In the Plan phase, which activity is most critical to establish before creating geometry?
During the Verify phase, which action confirms the part meets requirements?
options: Compare the model to specifications and evaluate mass/material properties

questions.text: If a part fails verification, what is the recommended next step?
options: Delete the model and start over
Return to Create phase to modify features and geometry

questions.text: Which deliverable typically represents the output of the Create phase before release?
options: A pre‑release part with completed core features
A BOM in an assembly file

questions.text: What does 'parametric modeling' mean in Creo?
options: Geometry is driven by dimensions and parameters that update dependent features
Models are freeform and ignore dimensions
Drawing dimensions never update the model

questions.text: Which statement best describes design associativity in Creo?
options: Only assemblies update when parts change
Drawings are static and never update
Changes propagate among part, assembly, and drawing modes via associative links
Files are independent copies with no links

questions.text: Which file extension identifies a part, assembly, and drawing respectively?
In a model‑centric workflow, downstream deliverables reference what?
Why is model‑centric design beneficial?
options: A change to the design model updates downstream deliverables automatically

questions.text: Which three areas form the main Creo interface?
What is the 'Working Directory' used for?
options: A hidden system folder for logs
A temporary cache deleted on exit
The default location for opening and saving files

questions.text: What does 'In Session' indicate in Creo?
options: Models are loaded into memory until erased or Creo is closed

questions.text: Which command removes models from memory without deleting them from disk?
How can you show only part/assembly/drawing types in Open dialog?
How do you access the embedded web browser?
options: Toggle Show Browser in the status bar

questions.text: What does 'Erase Current' do?
options: Removes the active model from memory and closes its window

questions.text: What does the Mini toolbar provide when you select geometry?
options: Context‑sensitive actions like Edit Dimensions, Edit Definition, Extrude

questions.text: Which color indicates preview geometry?
Which color indicates selected surfaces/edges?
Where do newly created features appear by default in the Model Tree?
How can feature order impact the model?
options: Later features build on earlier ones; order can change resulting geometry

questions.text: What happens to features after the Insert Location?
options: They are suppressed and unavailable as references until regeneration

questions.text: Which statement about moving the Model Tree is true?
options: It can be docked or detached and placed freely
It shows only in assembly mode

questions.text: What Model Tree state indicates a hidden item?
What is the Insert Location used for?
options: Controls where new features are created and which references are available

questions.text: What is the difference between Hide and Suppress?
options: Hide affects display visibility; Suppress removes from regeneration

questions.text: Why avoid saving with suppressed features?
options: Suppressed items are inactive and may hide missing design intent

questions.text: What does 'Suppress All' in the dialog do?
options: Suppresses the selected feature and its children

questions.text: Which tool displays editable dimensions on selected features?
Which action enters Edit mode quickly?
What do drag handles allow during editing?
options: Resize, reorient, or offset geometry dynamically

questions.text: Which menu option shows/hides drag handles in Edit mode?
Which menu option toggles sketch dimensions display?
What does Auto Regenerate do?
options: Updates geometry dynamically as you edit

questions.text: Which dashboard icon previews the completed feature?
Which dashboard icon resumes a paused edit?
Which four datum feature types can be created?
options: Datum planes, axes, points, coordinate systems

questions.text: Which constraint defines an offset datum plane?
Which datum axes are auto‑created by circles or holes?
What are datum planes commonly used for?
options: References for sketches, placement, dimensioning, assembly

questions.text: Which toggle shows datum plane tags?
Which toggle shows datum coordinate system tags?
Where can sketches be created?
options: On datum planes or solid surfaces

questions.text: Which rule ensures a valid sketch section?
options: No gaps or overlapping; closed loops when required

questions.text: Which Sketcher view aligns sketch to screen?
Which tool quickly adds dimensions to selected references?
Which element creates symmetry control within a sketch?
Which technique queries stacked geometry under the pointer?
options: Right‑click to cycle (Query to next item)

questions.text: Which rectangle type creates geometry symmetrically about the center?
Which circle type is defined by center and point?
Which circle type creates a circle tangent to three entities?
Which circle type creates a concentric circle?
Which rectangle starts by selecting opposite corners?
Which tool removes sketch segments dynamically?
Which operation divides an entity into multiple parts?
Which action mirrors entities about a Centerline?
Which trim closes a gap by trimming to other entities?
Why is design intent critical?
options: It ensures models update predictably when modified

questions.text: What do Weak vs Strong items represent?
options: Weak are auto‑applied; Strong are user‑defined or edited

questions.text: Which constraint makes points symmetric about a Centerline?
Which constraint makes a line tangent to an arc?
Which constraint aligns points to the same location?
Which constraint makes lines parallel?
How are Sketcher conflicts resolved?
options: Delete conflicts or convert dimensions to Reference

questions.text: Which constraint places a point at the middle of an entity?
Which dimension measures a line's length?
Which dimension measures angle between two references?
Which dimension toggles between radius and diameter?
Which dimension uses a Centerline to define diameter?
Which dimension measures length along an arc?
Which dimension type measures between two selected entities?
What does an extrude feature do?
options: Linearly adds or removes material perpendicular to the sketch plane

questions.text: Which depth option extrudes equally both sides?
Which option stops at the next encountered surface?
Which option extrudes through the entire model?
Which arrow flips creation direction?
What does the material direction arrow indicate?
options: Which side removes material for a cut

questions.text: Which depth requires the section to pass through a selected surface?
Which setting controls different values on each side?
What is a parent/child relationship?
options: A new feature depends on references from an existing feature

questions.text: What happens if a parent is deleted?
How does changing a parent affect children?
Which action establishes parent/child links?
Why consider design intent for every reference?
options: To ensure predictable updates with changes
